most_active_tickets.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0

common_issues.title: PiecesOS boot-up failure due to core dependency issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching PiecesOS Desktop Application, encountering errors during the core dependency check on both macOS and Windows. The issue appears linked to version 11.1.1 and stricter hardware requirements. Proposed solutions include updating to version 11.1.2, providing logs for diagnosis, and reinstalling the application.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Discussion Points

* Potential issue with Windows server access for users in Pakistan
* User's CPU may be older than 2015

## Solutions Proposed 

* Uninstalling and reinstalling Pieces OS using a specific download link
* Verifying the presence and content of a specific folder in the Pieces OS installation directory
* Checking for specific files and versions based on provided screenshots

## Current Status 

* Issue appears resolved for the user on Windows 
* Issue persists on MacOS for another user
* Second user has been advised to update to 11.1.2 version of PiecesOS

## Outcome 

* Resolved for the user on Windows 
* Still ongoing for the user on MacOS

## Next Steps

* The user on MacOS should update to 11.1.2 version of PiecesOS
* If the update doesn't resolve the issue, further investigation is required by PiecesOS support team

related_issues.title: core services
related_issues.text:
core services
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i had no issues with it in the begining but now when i try to open it now i encounter this error message 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e929cf56-d8a1-4185-8167-867ede2048e7)
## GitHub Issue Summary: 

**Key Points:**

* User @C2mokete reported an issue with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces support team.
* Mark-at-pieces provided a potential solution: update to PiecesOS version 11.1.2. 

**Problems Identified:**

* Slow boot-up time for PiecesOS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update to PiecesOS version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue was closed by Mark-at-pieces. 
* It is unclear whether the issue was resolved by the update.
* User @C2mokete can re-open the issue if the problem persists.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## Conversation Summary: Pieces Desktop Version Launch Issue

**Key points raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching the Pieces Desktop version (11.1.1)
* These issues seem related to stricter hardware requirements than initially communicated
* Similar issues reported in other threads [#131, #620, #456]
* User @GetReal444 suggests attaching logs from `c://Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/production/Support`

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces Desktop version 11.1.1 has launch issues on certain hardware configurations
* The initial hardware requirements communication was inaccurate
* Users are unable to use the Pieces software

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and is working on a patch
* Users are asked to provide logs to help diagnose the problem
* A patch (11.1.2) is released to address the issue

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is resolved with the release of Pieces Desktop version 11.1.2
* Users are encouraged to update and report any further issues

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch crash due to AVX2 CPU incompatibility
common_issues.description: PiecesOS version 11.1.1 crashes on launch for users with CPUs lacking AVX2 support, particularly on macOS and Windows. This issue stems from a dependency on the AVX2 instruction set. The Pieces team resolved this in version 11.1.2, urging users to update to the latest version.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** Users on macOS experiencing issues with PiecesOS after updating to MacOS Sequoia 15.2, specifically related to the CPU lackingAVX2 support.

**Key Points:**

* User (@gonzososa) reported the issue with helpful trace information.
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and traced it to AVX2 requirement not supported on user's CPU (Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU @ 2.50GHz).
* Pieces team actively worked on a fix and released a new version (11.1.2).

**Solutions:**

* Pieces team provided workaround suggestions: running specific commands to identify CPU information.
* Pieces team released a fix in version 11.1.2 addressing the AVX2 issue.

**Outcome:**

* User confirmed the fix in version 11.1.2 resolved their issue.


**Additional Notes:**

* Pieces team was responsive and provided clear communication throughout the issue resolution process.
* Issue resolution involved collaboration between multiple team members and the user.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue #620

**Key Points:**

- User (@GetReal444) experiencing issues booting up Pieces OS.
- Logs indicate a database error related to the "CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch" extension not supporting AVX2 processor instruction set.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Pieces team identified the hardware requirement issue as affecting more users.
- A solution to resolve the dependency issue was worked on around the clock.
- Version 11.1.2 of Pieces OS released with the fix for the AVX2 error.

**Outcome:**

- Issue resolved for the user after updating to version 11.1.2.

**Additional notes:**

- This issue is related to other reported issues (#624 and #625).
- There was a quick turnaround time from issue identification to solution implementation (approximately 48 hours).

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with PiecesOS booting up, including slow boot times and getting stuck on "ensuring core dependencies." Suggested solutions include updating to the latest version of PiecesOS, reinstalling the application, and verifying installation files.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## GitHub Issue Summary **Key Points:** * The issue is marked as resolved. **Problems Identified:** * No specific problems are identified in the provided conversation. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * No solutions are proposed or mentioned as being implemented. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is closed, indicating it has been resolved. **Additional Notes:** * The limited information provided makes it difficult to determine the exact nature of the issue or the resolution. * More context would be needed to provide a more comprehensive summary.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.1.1 launch failure due to missing AVX2 support
common_issues.description: Users reported Pieces OS 11.1.1 failing to launch on systems lacking AVX2 instruction set support. The issue stemmed from a dependency on the 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extension. The Pieces team quickly addressed the problem by releasing version 11.1.2, which resolved the dependency issue and enabled users to launch the application successfully.

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Key points:**

* User @Rohit0072 reported an issue with the Pieces app not booting up.
* Pieces support bot provided relevant resources and suggested related issues to troubleshoot.
* Team member @mark-at-pieces offered assistance and contact information.
* Another team member @tsavo-at-pieces identified connections to other reported issues (#620, #624, #625) and assured a fix would be released soon.

**Solutions:**

* Updating to PiecesOS version 11.1.2 was suggested to resolve the issue.

**Outcome:**

* The issue was closed after the suggested update with the user instructed to reopen if not resolved.

**Current status:**

* The issue remains closed, indicating potential resolution for the user. However, if they experience further problems, they are to reopen the issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch and download issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS launch failures and difficulties downloading local LLMs. Issues often involve database errors or incomplete downloads. Solutions include updating to the latest PiecesOS version (11.1.2) and providing logs for further analysis.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Key Findings in Conversation Regarding Downloading Local LLMs

**Key Points:**

* User reported receiving an error message related to downloading local LLMs in Pieces.
* Error message: "Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress"
* User asked for support and provided details on the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Inability to download local LLMs.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces Support Team requested support logs.
* Suggested trying to download another LLM to check if the error is consistent.
* Potential resolution in Pieces version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User was asked to confirm whether the issue is resolved in version 11.1.2.
* If unresolved, the issue could be reopened.
* Current status is unclear, awaiting user confirmation.

**Additional Notes:**

* Related issues: Users experiencing similar challenges are linked.
* Additional helpful resources are provided.

Overall, the conversation highlights a potential issue with downloading local LLMs in Pieces. The support team offered guidance and a possible solution in a newer version. User confirmation on the status is needed for further analysis.

## Conversation Summary: Pieces Desktop Version Launch Issue

**Key points raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching the Pieces Desktop version (11.1.1)
* These issues seem related to stricter hardware requirements than initially communicated
* Similar issues reported in other threads [#131, #620, #456]
* User @GetReal444 suggests attaching logs from `c://Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/production/Support`

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces Desktop version 11.1.1 has launch issues on certain hardware configurations
* The initial hardware requirements communication was inaccurate
* Users are unable to use the Pieces software

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and is working on a patch
* Users are asked to provide logs to help diagnose the problem
* A patch (11.1.2) is released to address the issue

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is resolved with the release of Pieces Desktop version 11.1.2
* Users are encouraged to update and report any further issues

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS launch failures:** The most frequent issues revolve around boot-up failures and crashes, particularly in version 11.1.1. Focus on addressing the root causes, such as core dependency issues and AVX2 incompatibility.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** The launch issues related to AVX2 incompatibility highlight the need for clearer communication about minimum hardware requirements for PiecesOS. Update documentation and communication channels to prevent similar issues in the future.

**Investigate and address slow boot times:** While not as frequent as launch failures, slow boot times are a recurring concern. Investigate the reasons behind these slowdowns and explore optimization strategies to improve the user experience.

**Monitor the effectiveness of version 11.1.2:** Many reported issues seem resolved in version 11.1.2. Continuously monitor user feedback and support tickets to ensure the update effectively addresses the problems and no new issues arise.

**Develop a more robust download and installation process:** Issues related to incomplete downloads and potential installation errors suggest room for improvement in the download and installation process. Explore ways to make it more resilient and user-friendly.

**Proactively communicate known issues and solutions:** Maintain a dedicated space (e.g., a status page or forum thread) to proactively communicate known issues, workarounds, and planned resolutions. This can help reduce support ticket volume and user frustration.

**Gather more detailed logs and system information:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive logs and system information when reporting issues. This will help the support team diagnose problems more efficiently and provide targeted solutions.

**Consider automated troubleshooting tools:** Explore the possibility of developing automated troubleshooting tools or scripts that users can run to identify common problems and potentially resolve them without needing to contact support.
